main event: A bluish-green brilliant light was observed exploding with small red bursts and a sound of explosion on November 21, 1957, in Levittown, L.I., New York. The observation lasted a few seconds and was reported by a civilian.
interesting points: The sighting involved a bluish-green brilliant light that exploded with small red bursts and a sound of explosion, which is atypical for known aircraft or natural phenomena.
The source of the report was a civilian, adding credibility to the observation.
The sighting only lasted a few seconds, indicating a brief but intense event.

A Brown University professor of astronomy suggested the possibility of a weather balloon disturbance. This raises questions about the potential misinterpretation of known objects as UFOs during that time period.
The report contains detailed weather information, highlighting the thoroughness of the investigation into the sighting.
sighted object: bluish-green brilliant light exploding with small red bursts
